nodes.text: Looks like the floor is starting to collapse here... There are cracks wide enough to see through to the cave area below.
The floor here is already crumbling and the ground is very thin. I bet it wouldn't take much for this section to collapse to the cave below.
I can see the cave below through the cracks. I'm pretty sure that must be the Sea Serpent lagoon below me.
In fact, I can see the Sea Serpent right below me!
I can see through the cracks to the cavern below. It looks like some sort of lagoon down there.
It definitely doesn't look stable. I'm just not feelin' a death wish today.
Nothing, just a lot of cracks.
I already checked. It's devoid of magic.
Those rocks fell into the water below and caused a big splash!
There is one very large and very dead Sea Serpent down there. The rockfall must have killed it.
I'm not sure anything short of something making a big "boom" is going to open that up.
Still not going to stand on it, though. With my luck, I'd stand on just the right spot... or just the wrong spot...
As thin as the floor is here, I don't think the blast of a boom will do more than crumble this a little more. It would be the waste of a Boom.
I'll put this right where the floor looks weakest... where all the cracks and fissures meet...
Oh, right. Death wish, anyone? Not me.
If this isn't the most irresponsible thing I've ever done, it's definitely in the Top Three. I'm reconsidering.
